properties.name: Billy Goat Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Maude430 N. Michigan Ave, chicago, ilLower level- i.e. take stairs below street level. I KNOW...it\'s a bit touristy now but it\'s still one of my favorites. Made famous by John Belushi\'s "cheezeburger cheezburger" skit on Sat. Night Live. It\'s a real place with amazing history- frequented by Tribune writers for lunch and after work drinks. Also famed for putting up a sign stating "No Repulicans Allowed" during the republican convention and an issue with bringing a goat to cubs games. Visit this undergroud (really) tavern and check out the photos on the wall.

properties.name: Smith Stained Glass Museum- end of Navy Pier
properties.description: Posted by Maude 600 East Grand Avenue, chicago, ilI say, skip most of Navy Pier and head straight for the end where you will find the stained glass museum. They were taken from rebuilt/demolished Chicago residences and buildings. I love walking the dark halls with the back-lit glass!

properties.name: The Art Institute of Chicago
properties.description: Posted by Paulirving  111 South Michigan Avenue, Chicago, Illinois 60603-6404The Art Institute of Chicago is one of the premier art museums and art schools in the United States, known especially for the extensive collection of Impressionist and American art in its museum. It is located on the western edge of Grant Park, at 111 South Michigan Avenue in Chicago, Illinois.
